#Text=Australian woman claims Church of Scientology imprisoned her for twelve years
#Text=Thursday , May 7 , 2015

#Text=Valeska Paris , an Australian woman and former Scientologist , has claimed that the Church of Scientology imprisoned her for twelve years aboard the Scientology - owned cruise ship , Freewinds .
#Text=The Church of Scientology 's cruise ship Freewinds in Bonaire .
#Text=Paris was born in Switzerland but her parents moved her to the United Kingdom when she was six so they could be closer to the church 's headquarters .
#Text=She joined the Sea Org aged 14 .
#Text=In 1995 , at age seventeen , she was told to disconnect from her mother .
#Text=Paris claims she was first sent to the ship aged eighteen for two weeks as a teenager but ended up spending twelve years there .
#Text=Paris also claims that her passport was taken away from her and she was forced to work in the engine room .
#Text=I was basically hauled in and told that my mum had attacked the church and that I needed to disconnect from her because she was suppressive . Valeska Paris
#Text=I was basically hauled in and told that my mum had attacked the church and that I needed to disconnect from her because she was suppressive .
#Text=Her mother had spoken out against Scientology on French television after her ex-husband and Paris 's father , Albert Jaquier , committed suicide after he lost his fortune to Scientology .
#Text=Paris claims that she was kept at Flag Land Base in Clearwater , Florida until she was eighteen and then transferred to the Freewinds .
#Text=On board the Freewinds , Paris claims that she was working from 6:00am to midnight and due to lack of sleep ended up being a walking zombie .
#Text=She also claims that in 1997 and 1998 , she was tasked with removal of asbestos from the ship .
#Text=In 2007 , Paris left the ship after a confrontation with the ship 's management .
#Text=She was eventually sent to Rehabilitation Project Force in Sydney , which the Church describes as a religious retreat , but critics charge is a forced work camp .
#Text=Here , she met her future husband and subsequently left the church .
#Text=In a statement to the Australian Broadcasting Corporation , the Church denied these allegations :
#Text=She certainly was n't ' forced ' to be there .
#Text=She was also never forced to perform labour in the engine room .
#Text=They also claimed Paris was a volunteer and claim she has a vested interest for misrepresenting her experiences with the Church .
#Text=The Church also claims that Paris not having her passport was maritime procedure .
